summary: Email from Mark Epstein to Stacey Richman forwarding autopsy images and arguing that Jeffrey Epstein's neck injuries are inconsistent with suicide by hanging, suggesting he was dead for hours before being found and possibly garroted.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.role: Sender of email, brother of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mark Epstein forwards autopsy images and analysis to attorney Stacey Richman, disputing the official narrative of his brother's death and suggesting evidence of foul play.

persons.name: Stacey Richman
persons.context: Attorney to whom Mark Epstein sends autopsy analysis and images regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as JE3, his autopsy and the circumstances of his death are the subject of the email analysis, with claims his neck injuries are inconsistent with suicide.

connections.description: Mark Epstein is the brother of Jeffrey Epstein and is disputing the official findings regarding his brother's death.
Mark Epstein is communicating autopsy findings and images to attorney Stacey Richman, suggesting a legal or advisory relationship.

events.title: Mark Epstein emails autopsy analysis
events.description: Mark Epstein sends an email to attorney Stacey Richman with attached autopsy images and an analysis arguing Jeffrey Epstein's neck injuries indicate he was dead for 2-6 hours when found and was garroted, not hanged.

keyFacts: Mark Epstein claims Jeffrey Epstein's neck groove proves he was dead for 2-6 hours when found.
The neck groove is described as too narrow to match a sheet noose and more consistent with an electric cord or garroting.
The groove's position low on the neck is argued to be inconsistent with a hanging, which would leave a groove higher up towards the ears.
The email includes attachments of autopsy images (PATH-Autopsy_019.JPG, PATH-Autopsy_020.JPG, PATH-Autopsy_021.JPG).
This correspondence shows active dispute and investigation into the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death years after the event.
